title: China's Xi says opening brings progress, closure backwardness
text:
April 10, 2018 / 2:08 AM / in 24 minutes China's Xi says opening brings progress, closure backwardness Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
BOAO, China (Reuters) - Chinese President Xi Jinping said on Tuesday Chinaâ€™s reform and opening up will definitely succeed and that a Cold War mentality, zero-sum thinking, and isolationism would hit walls. Chinese President Xi Jinping speaks with U.N. Secretary-General Antonio Guterres, unseen, during their meeting at the Great Hall of the People in Beijing, China, April 8, 2018. Madoka Ikegami/Pool via REUTERS 
Xi, speaking at the Boao Forum for Asia in Hainan province, said that opening brings progress, while closure would lead to backwardness. Reporting by Kevin Yao; Editing by Robert Birsel
